memberdef.name: P_GROUP1_LEN
memberdef.initializer: 128 /* Size in bytes of the p number */

memberdef.name: P_GROUP14_LEN
memberdef.initializer: 256 /* Size in bytes of the p number for group 14 */

memberdef.name: P_GROUP16_LEN
memberdef.initializer: 512 /* Size in bytes of the p number for group 16 */

memberdef.name: P_GROUP18_LEN
memberdef.initializer: 1024 /* Size in bytes of the p number for group 18 */

memberdef.argsstring: (enum ssh_publickey_hash_type type, unsigned char *hash, size_t len)
memberdef.name: ssh_get_fingerprint_hash

briefdescription.para: Get a hash as a human-readable hex- or base64-string.

detaileddescription.para: This gets an allocated fingerprint hash. If it is a SHA sum, it will return an unpadded base64 strings. If it is a MD5 sum, it will return hex string. Either way, the output is prepended by the hash-type.

simplesect.para: Do NOT use MD5 or SHA1! Those hash functions are being deprecated.

parameterdescription.para: Which sort of hash is given, use SSH_PUBLICKEY_HASH_SHA256 or better.
The hash to be converted to fingerprint.
Length of the buffer to convert.

simplesect.para: Returns the allocated fingerprint hash or NULL on error.

memberdef.argsstring: (enum ssh_publickey_hash_type type, unsigned char *hash, size_t len)
memberdef.name: ssh_print_hash

briefdescription.para: Print a hash as a human-readable hex- or base64-string.

detaileddescription.para: This prints an unpadded base64 strings for SHA sums and hex strings for MD5 sum. Either way, the output is prepended by the hash-type.

parameterdescription.para: Which sort of hash is given. Use SSH_PUBLICKEY_HASH_SHA256 or better.
The hash to be converted to fingerprint.
Length of the buffer to convert.
